question: Who did Paul say he was not sent from (Gal. 1:1)?
By whom did Paul say he was sent (Gal. 1:1)?
Besides Jesus Christ who also sent Paul (Gal. 1:1)?
Who raised Christ from the dead (Gal. 1:1)?
To whom is the book of Galatians addressed (Gal. 1:2)?
choice: All believers in the Lord Jesus Christ

question: What did Paul say was from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ in his greeting to the Galatians (Gal. 1:3)?
From what did Jesus rescue us (Gal. 1:4)?
For what did Jesus give himself (Gal. 1:4)?
According to what did Jesus rescue us from the present evil age (Gal. 1:4)?
choice: The will of God the Father

question: What is to our God and Father forever and ever (Gal. 1:5)?
At what was Paul astonished (Gal. 1:6)?
choice: That they had so easily fallen into sin
That they so quickly deserted the one who had called them
That they so totally abandoned the way of the righteous
That they rejected the truth and embraced a lie

question: To what did Paul say the Galatians had turned to (Gal. 1:6)?
What were some people doing to the Galatians according to Paul (Gal. 1:7)?
choice: Putting a stumbling block in front of them

question: What were some people doing to the Galatians according to Paul (Gal. 1:7)?
choice: Putting a stumbling block in front of them

question: Who did Paul say to reject if even they preached another gospel (Gal. 1:8)?
What did Paul say should happen to one who preaches another gospel (Gal. 1:9)?
choice: They should be under God’s curse
They should perish in their sins
They should be struck mute never to speak again

question: What would Paul not be if he tried to please people (Gal. 1:10)?
choice: A faithful minister of the gospel
A messenger of God the Father

question: When did Paul say he would not be a servant of Jesus Christ (Gal. 1:10)?
choice: If he followed the way of the world
If he tried to please people

question: What was not the origin of the gospel (Gal. 1:11)?
How had Paul received the gospel (Gal. 1:12)?
choice: By a dream from God the Father
By the words of Stephen the martyr

question: What had Paul done previously (Gal. 1:13)?
choice: Persecuted and tried to destroy the church
Trampled on the word of God
Put in prison those who followed Jesus

question: For what was Paul previously zealous of (Gal. 1:14)?
What did Paul say God did by his grace (Gal. 1:15)?
Where was Paul to preach (Gal. 1:16)?
What was God pleased to reveal in Paul (Gal. 1:16f)?
After Paul was called what did he not do (Gal. 1:16)?
choice: Seek the approval of the Jewish elders
Seek any longer to persecute the church

question: Where did Paul go after he was called (Gal. 1:17)?
Where did Paul not go after he was called (Gal. 1:17)?
After going to Arabia to where did Paul return (Gal. 1:17)?
With whom did Paul stay for 15 days (Gal. 1:18)?
How long after his call did Paul go up to Jerusalem (Gal. 1:18)?
Who did Paul get acquainted with when he first when up to Jerusalem after his call Gal. 1:18)?
When Paul initially went to Jerusalem who was the only other person besides Cephas that he mentioned seeing (Gal. 1:19)?
Of what did Paul assure the Galatians (Gal. 1:20)?
choice: What he was writing was not a lie
He had repented of his former life
He was not seeking to harm the church any longer

question: Where did Paul go after going up to Jerusalem to see Cephas (Gal. 1:21)?
To what churches did Paul say he was unknown after he had been call (Gal. 1:22)?
What had the churches of Judea heard (Gal. 1:23)?
choice: The gospel was being preached even among the Gentiles
The Pharisee who had killed their brothers had seen Christ
The man who formerly persecuted them was not preaching the faith
The man who had put Stephen to death was now preaching the gospel

question: What was the churches of Judea’s response when they heard that Paul who had formerly persecuted them was now preaching the faith (Gal. 1:24)?
When did Paul go up to Jerusalem with Barnabas (Gal. 2:1)
With whom did Paul go up to Jerusalem after fourteen years (Gal. 2:1)?
Who did Paul take with him when he went up to Jerusalem after 14 years (Gal. 2:1)?
What did Paul present to the leaders in Jerusalem (Gal. 2:2)?
choice: His meeting of Jesus on the road to Damascus
The gospel that he preached among the Gentiles
The grace that God had shown him
How the Spirit and bound all peoples into the church

question: Why did Paul present the gospel he had been preaching to the leaders in Jerusalem (Gal. 2:2)?
choice: He needed the support of those who had known Christ from the beginning
He wanted to make sure he was not running his race in vain
He wanted to tell them of the mighty works of God

question: Who did Paul say was not compelled in Jerusalem to be circumcised (Gal. 2:3)?
What ethnic background was Titus who was not compelled to be circumcised (Gal. 2:3)?
Who did Paul say had infiltrated their ranks to spy on the freedom we have in Christ (Gal. 2:4)?
choice: Some believer who had fallen away

question: What did Paul say was the goal of those who had infiltrated their ranks (Gal. 2:4)?
choice: To put them back under the law

question: Why did Paul not give in to the infiltrators for a moment (Gal. 2:5)?
choice: That the gospel may be preserved
That truth may shine into all the world
That their errors might be rejected by all

question: What does God not show (Gal. 2:6)?
What did those held in high esteem not do for Paul (Gal. 2:6)?
choice: Change his proclamation of the gospel
Reject his gospel to the Gentiles

question: What did those of high esteem in Jerusalem recognize (Gal. 2:7)?
choice: That Paul was anointed by the Holy Spirit to preach the gospel
That Paul preached the gospel with the power given to him by the Father
That Paul was entrusted with preaching the gospel to the uncircumcised
That Paul had seen a vision of Christ on the road to Damascus

question: To whom was it recognized that Paul was to preach the gospel (Gal. 2:7)?
To whom had the preaching of the gospel to the circumcised been committed (Gal. 2:7)?
How did Paul identify himself by the work God had done in him (Gal. 2:8)?
choice: A preacher of the Gospel to the world
A servant of the Lord Jesus

question: All of the following gave Paul the right hand of fellowship in Jerusalem EXCEPT (Gal. 2:9)
To whom did the pillars at Jerusalem agree that Paul should go to (Gal. 2:9?
What one thing did the pillars at Jerusalem ask Paul and Barnabas to remember to do (Gal. 2:10)?
choice: Not eat meat offered to idols

question: Who did Paul oppose to his face at Antioch (Gal. 2:11)?
Where did Paul oppose Peter to his face (Gal. 2:11)?
What did Peter do before men came from James (Gal. 2:12)?
choice: He used to support no circumcision of the Gentiles
He used to eat with the Gentiles
He used to wash the feet of Gentiles
He used to preach the gospel to the Gentiles

question: Of whom was Peter afraid in terms of eating with Gentiles (Gal. 2:12)?
choice: The men who had come from James
The men who had come from John

question: Who also was led astray into Peter’s hypocrisy of not eating with the Gentiles (Gal. 2:13)?
Of what did Paul accuse Peter after men came from James (Gal. 2:14)?
choice: Wanting to circumcise the flesh but ignoring the spirit

question: What did Paul accuse Peter of doing after men came from James to Antioch (Gal. 2:14)?
choice: Forcing the Gentiles to pay for the poor in Jerusalem
Forcing the Gentiles to observe Jewish customs
Forcing the Gentiles to serve the Jewish believers

question: How is a person not justified (Gal. 2:15)?
How is a person justified (Gal. 2:16)?
choice: By the work of the Spirit of God
By turning from sin to God the Father

question: Who will be justified by works of the law (Gal. 2:16)?
choice: All who keep the law perfectly
Only those who trust in Jesus
All who repent of their sin

question: How does Paul see himself if he rebuilds what he had destroyed (Gal. 2:18)?
Why did Paul die to the law (Gal. 2:19)?
choice: So that he might be free in Christ
So that he proclaim the gospel to the Gentiles
So that others might glorify God
So that he might live for God

question: With whom has Paul been crucified (Gal. 2:20)?
Who lives in Paul (Gal. 2:20)?
How does Paul now live (Gal. 2:20)?
choice: By faith in the Son of God
In the redemption purchased by Christ
In the power of the Spirit

question: What two things did Paul say Christ had done for him so that he now lives by faith in the Son of God (Gal. 2:20)?
choice: He forgave Paul all his sins and redeemed him
He loved him and gave himself for Paul
He redeemed Paul from the law of sin and death
He saved Paul from the bonds of death

question: What was the result if righteousness could be gained through the law (Gal. 2:21)?
choice: Christ would not have been crucified
Grace would have set us free
Christ would have died for nothing
Salvation would not be by grace

question: How would Christ have died for nothing (Gal. 2:21)?
choice: If Christ had not been raised from the dead
If God was not merciful and just
If we refused to believe that Christ died for our sins
If righteousness could be gained through the law

question: What does Paul ask the “foolish Galatians” (Gal. 3:1)?
When asking the Galatians who bewitched them, how does Paul address them (Gal. 3:1)?
What had the Galatians how was Christ clearly portrayed (Gal. 3:1)?
How had the Galatians not received the Spirit (Gal. 3:2)?
choice: By the works of the law

question: How had the Galatians received the Spirit (Gal. 3:2)?
choice: By obeying to the gospel that Paul preached
By the works of the law
By following in the way of Christ

question: How, by what means, had the Galatians begun (Gal. 3:3)
choice: By the redemption that is in Christ Jesus

question: Paul rebukes the Galatians that they were trying to finish by what means (Gal. 3:3)?
What did Paul say God did not do by works of the Law (Gal. 3:5)?
What did Paul say God did not do by works of the Law (Gal. 3:5)?
choice: Show them mercy in Christ Jesus

question: Who does Paul cite as having believed God (Gal. 3:6)?
What was credited to Abraham by him believing (Gal. 3:6)?
How was Abraham credited with righteousness (Gal. 3:6)?
Who are the children of Abraham (Gal. 3:7)?
Whose children are those who have faith (Gal. 3:7)?
How did God announce the gospel in advance to Abraham (Gal. 3:8)?
choice: He foresaw it in the sacrifice of Isaac
When God said all the nations would be blessed through him
When Jesus forgave the sins of all the world

question: What did Scripture foresee (Gal. 3:8)?
choice: That God would justify the Gentiles by faith
That redemption would come by Jesus Christ
That all the world would be saved
That the Gentiles would turn to God for the forgiveness of sin

question: To whom did God say “all nations of the earth would be blessed through you” (Gal. 3:8)?
What was Abraham called (Gal. 3:9)?
Who are blessed along with Abraham (Gal. 3:9)?
choice: Those who walk in his ways
Those who are circumcised in the heart

question: Who are under a curse (Gal. 3:10)?
choice: All who rely on the works of the law
All who are circumcised in their flesh
All who have turned after their own way

question: What are all those who rely on the works of the law under (Gal. 3:10)?
Scripture says who is cursed (Gal. 3:10)?
choice: By those not believing that Christ has risen from the dead
By not following in the way of Christ our redeemer
By not continuing to do everything written in the Book of the Law
By not continuing to do everything written in the Lamb’s Book of Life

question: Who is not justified before God (Gal. 3:11)?
choice: Anyone who believes that they are righteous
Anyone who relies on the law

question: Who lives by faith (Gal. 3:11)?
How do the righteous live (Gal. 3:11)?
What is not based on faith (Gal. 3:12)?
What does the law say (Gal. 3:12)?
choice: The person who follows the commandments will live
The person who does these things will live by them
Whoever lives according to the law will live
By the works of the law we will be justified

question: From what did Christ redeem us (Gal. 3:13)?
choice: The obligations of the old covenant

question: How did Christ redeem us from the curse of the law (Gal. 3:13)?
choice: By shedding his blood for us
By giving us his blessing instead
By becoming a curse for us

question: Who is cursed as it is written (Gal. 3:13)?
choice: All who are justified by without works of the law
Everyone who is hung on a pole

question: Why did Christ redeem us (Gal. 3:14)?
choice: So that the blessing of Israel might be extended to the Gentiles as well
So that the blessing of Abraham might come to the Gentiles
So that the covenant made with David might save the world
So that Jesus might be lord of all

question: What blessing did Christ want to give to the Gentiles (Gal. 3:14)?
What did we receive by faith (Gal. 3:14)?
What can no one set aside or add to (Gal. 3:15)?
To whom was the promised “seed” made with Abraham (Gal. 3:16)?
How many years after the covenant with Abraham was the law introduced (Gal. 3:17)?
What came 430 years after the promise given to Abraham (Gal. 3:16)?
What was the law unable to set aside or do away with (Gal. 3:17)?
choice: The prediction of the prophets of God
The will of God the Father toward Israel

question: What did God give to Abraham by promise (Gal. 3:18)?
How was the law given (Gal. 3:19)?
Why was the law given (Gal. 3:19)?
choice: It came because the promise was weak
It was given because Israel became a nation
It was given because faith had disappeared
It was added because of transgressions

question: After the law was given through angels to whom was it entrusted (Gal. 3:19)?
What does a mediator imply (Gal. 3:20)?
Paul in Galatians reminds them, God is _______ (Gal. 3:20)
What was the law not able to impart (Gal. 3:22)?
To what does Paul say “Absolutely not” (Gal. 3:21)?
choice: The Gentiles must observe the law
The law is opposed to the promises of God
The law can bring forgiveness of sins

question: If a law had been given that could impart life then what out have come by the law (Gal. 3:21)?
What had Scripture locked everything under the control of (Gal. 3:22)?
Through what was the promise given (Gal. 3:22)?
choice: Through the blood of Jesus Christ
Through the unchanging character of God

question: To whom was what was promised given (Gal. 3:22)?
choice: To those who are under the law
To those to whom the promise was given

question: Where does Paul say we were before coming to faith (Gal. 3:23)?
choice: Held in custody under the law
Slaves to our trespasses and sins

question: Paul says we were locked up under the law until what (Gal. 3:23)?
choice: Until we were set free by Christ
Until we were baptized into the Spirit
Until the faith that was to come was revealed
Until Christ died for our sins

question: What role did the law play until Christ came (Gal. 3:24)?
When are we no longer under the guardian of the law (Gal. 3:25)?
What are we in Christ through faith (Gal. 3:26)?
Who has clothed themselves with Christ (Gal. 3:27)?
choice: All who have been baptized into Christ
All who have received the Spirit
All who believe that Christ died and rose from the dead
All who are members of his body

question: What have all who were baptized into Christ done (Gal. 3:27)?
choice: Freed ourselves from the law of sin and death
Received the Spirit in his name

question: All of the following were listed as one in Christ EXCEPT (Gal. 3:28)
If one belongs to Christ then what is the person (Gal. 3:29)?
If one belongs to Christ then what is the person (Gal. 3:29)?
Who is no different than a slave (Gal. 4:1)?
While he is young to whom is the heir subject (Gal. 4:2)?
Under what does Paul say we were in slavery (Gal.  4:3)?
choice: Under the law of sin and death
Under the shackles of the law of Moses
Under the elemental spiritual forces of the world

question: When did Jesus come (Gal. 4:4)?
choice: When the world was finally ready
When the set time had fully come

question: Of whom does Paul say Jesus was born (Gal. 4:4)?
Under what was Christ born (Gal. 4:4)?
choice: Under the promise given to Abraham

question: Why did Christ redeem those under the law (Gal. 4:5)?
choice: That we might be sanctified by the Spirit
That we might receive the adoption of sonship
That we might be set free from sin and death
That we might receive the new covenant

question: Who did Christ redeem so that they might receive the adoption of sonship (Gal. 4:5)?
choice: Those who were under the law
Those who were the children of Abraham

question: What did God send into our hearts (Gal. 4:6)?
What does the Spirit call out in our hearts (Gal. 4:6)?
When the Spirit calls out in our hearts Abba, what does that show (Gal. 4:7)?
choice: We are no longer under the law but under grace
We are no longer a slave but God’s child
We are no longer an heir but a son
We are no longer children of this world but the kingdom of God

question: What has God made us since we are God’s child (Gal. 4:7)?
Formerly, to whom were they slaves (Gal. 4:8)?
choice: To those who were under the law
To those who by nature were not gods
To those who wanted to enslave them
To those who were children of Abraham

question: When does Paul say the Galatians were slaves (Gal. 4:8)?
choice: When they were children of Abraham
When they were in the world
When they did not know God
When they were under the law

question: What does Paul call the forces that the Galatians were turning back to (Gal. 4:9)?
What does Paul say the Galatians are doing (Gal. 4:10)?
choice: Observing the laws on what they were eating C Observing special days, months, and seasons
Judging others who did not follow their traditions

question: What did Paul fear (Gal. 4:11)?
choice: That they had rejected the freedom in Christ
That he had wasted his efforts on them
That he had preached another gospel to them
That he would never see them again

question: Who had Paul become like (Gal. 4:12)?
Why had Paul first preached the gospel to the Galatians (Gal. 4:13)?
choice: Because the Spirit led him there

question: What did Paul do because of his illness (Gal. 4:13)?
choice: He sought the Lord three times to remove it
He could not come to them
He preached the gospel to the Galatians
He was with them every Sabbath

question: In his illness, how had the Galatians received him (Gal. 4:14)?
choice: As if he were an apostle of Christ
As if he were their pastor
As if he were their brother in Christ
As if he were an angel of God

question: How had the Galatians not treated Paul in his illness (Gal. 4:14)?
What would some of the Galatians done for Paul in his illness (Gal. 4:15)?
choice: Given him the best wine that they had
Torn out their eyes and given them to Paul
Bathed him in water every day

question: Paul asked them if he was their enemy because _______ (Gal. 4:16)
choice: He told him the law was enslaving them
He was trying to free them for their bondage

question: What do Paul’s opponents want (Gal. 4:17)?
choice: To make them jealous of the Jews
To win the Galatians over to have zeal for them
To misguide the Galatians back into keeping the law
To get the Galatians to have zeal for the traditions of the elders

question: When is being zealous good (Gal. 4:18)?
choice: When the purpose is for righteousness
When it is for Christ alone

question: What was Paul in pain of childbirth for the Galatians (Gal. 4: 19)?
choice: Until the church is in agreement
Until they are holy and God is holy
Until the Spirit is in their hearts
Until Christ is formed in them

question: What is Paul until Christ is formed in the Galatians (Gal. 4:19)?
choice: Trusting in the message of the gospel

question: What is Paul concerning the Galatians (Gal. 4:20)?
How many sons did Abraham have (Gal. 4:21)?
Abraham’s wife who was born of the slave woman was born according to _____ (Gal. 4:23)
Abraham’s son born of the free woman was born as a result of _____ (Gal. 4:23)
What do Abraham’s two women (Sarah and Hagar) represent (Gal. 4:24)?
choice: Those under the law and those under grace

question: Where is the covenant represented by Hagar (Gal. 4:25)?
To what city does Mount Sinai/Hagar correspond (Gal. 4:25)?
Who is our free mother (Gal. 4:26)?
choice: Rome the capital of the world

question: What is written for the barren woman to do (Gal. 4:27)?
Who was told by shout for joy and cry aloud (Gal. 4:27)?
Who has more children than a woman who has a husband (Gal. 4:27)?
Paul tells the Galatians they are like whom (Gal. 4:28)?
Paul identifies the Galatians as ________ (Gal. 4:28)?
How was the son born who was persecuted (Gal. 4:29)?
choice: By the power of the Spirit
By the power of the word of God
By the power of Jesus Christ
By the power of the promise

question: What did the Scripture say to do with the slave woman and her son (Gal. 4:30)?
Paul identifies himself and the Galatians as children of ______ (Gal. 4:31)?
What does Paul warn them not to be burdened again with (Gal. 5:1)?
When will Christ be of no value to the Galatians (Gal. 5:2)?
choice: If they return to their idols
If they let themselves be circumcised
If they submit to the law

question: What is everyone who lets himself be circumcised obligated to (Gal. 5:3)?
choice: Not eat meat offered to idols
Obeying the traditions of the elders

question: Who is alienated from Christ (Gal. 5:4)?
choice: Those who turn away from grace
Those trying to be justified by the law
Those who are servants of the law

question: From what have those trying to be justified by the law fallen away from (Gal. 5:4)?
How do we eagerly await by faith the righteousness we hope (Gal. 5:5)?
In Christ was has no value (Gal. 5:6)?
Paul acknowledge what were the Galatians doing well (Gal. 5:7)?
Paul asks the Galatians who cut in on them to keep them from _____ (Gal. 5:7)?
What does a little yeast do (Gal. 5:9)?
choice: Expands into a full loaf of bread
Works with the flour to produce enough food to feed a family
Works through the whole batch of dough
Feeds many from the way it works

question: What does Paul say will happen to the one throwing the Galatians into confusion (Gal. 5:10)?
choice: They will be left under the law

question: What is Paul confident in the Lord about (Gal. 5:10)?
choice: That they will take no other view
That they will not forsake the gospel
That they will be triumphant in Christ
That they will hold fast to his teaching

question: Paul asks why he was still being persecuted, if he was still doing what (Gal. 5:11)?
choice: Obeying the tradition of the elders

question: What would be abolished if Paul was still preaching circumcision (Gal. 5:11)?
choice: The freedom we have in Christ

question: What does Paul wish the agitators would do (Gal. 5:12)?
What does Paul call those whom he wishes would go the whole way and emasculate themselves (Gal. 5:12)?
For what are the Galatians called (Gal. 5:13)?
Because we are free, what should we not do (Gal. 5:13)?
choice: Return to the bondage of the law

question: What should we do instead of indulging the flesh (Gal. 5:13)?
choice: Live in the freedom of the Spirit

question: In what is the entire law fulfilled (Gal. 5:14)?
choice: Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ

question: How will then end of being destroyed (Gal. 5:15)?
choice: If they do not have compassion on one another
If they let the agitators into their midst
If they bit and devour one another

question: If one walks by the Spirit what will they not do (Gal. 5:16)?
choice: Not walk under the bondage of the law
Gratify the desires of the flesh

question: What desires are contrary to the desires of the flesh (Gal. 5:17)?
When are you not under the law (Gal. 5:18)?
choice: If you are led by the Spirit
If Christ has set you free
If you are children of Abraham

question: All of the following are listed as acts of the flesh EXCEPT (Gal. 5:19-21)?
All of the following are listed as acts of the flesh EXCEPT (Gal. 5:19-21)?

All of the following are listed as fruits of the Spirit EXCEPT (Gal. 5:22-23)?
Against what things is there no law (Gal. 5:23)?
What have those who belong to Christ crucified (Gal. 5:24)?
What does Paul say we should not do to each other (Gal. 5:26)?
What does Paul say we should not do to each other (Gal. 5:26)?
What does Paul say we should not become if we are living by the Spirit (Gal. 5:26)?
Who does Paul say should restore one caught in a sin (Gal. 6:1)?
choice: Those who live by the Spirit
Those who are walking in grace

question: How should the person caught in a sin be restored (Gal. 6:1)?
What does Paul say the Galatians should carry (Gal. 6:2)?
What will the Galatians who carry each other’s burdens fulfill (Gal. 6:2)?
Who does Paul say deceives themselves (Gal. 6:3)?
choice: Those who act according to the flesh
Those who cause factions among those who are in Christ
Those who think of themselves as something when they are not
Those who are trying to bring them into submission to the law of the flesh

question: What does Paul say the Galatians should test (Gal. 6:4)?
choice: Those seeking to join the church

question: If they test themselves what can they do (Gal. 6:4)?
choice: Follow in the way of Christ
Avoid the errors of the wicked

question: What should each person carry (Gal. 6:5)?
With whom should the Galatians share all good things (Gal. 6:6)?
In what have they received instruction (Gal. 6:6)?
Of what should the Galatians not be deceived (Gal. 6:7)?
choice: Paul desired to come to them

question: What does a person reap (Gal. 6:7)?
What will those who sow to please their flesh reap (Gal. 6:8)?
Who will reap eternal life (Gal. 6:8)?
choice: Those who sow the grace of God
Those who sow to please the Spirit
Those who love their neighbors as themselves
Those who plant the fruits of the Spirit

question: What will those who sow to please the Spirit reap (Gal. 6:8)?
In what does Paul say we should not grow weary (Gal. 6:9)?
choice: Walking in the way of Christ

question: What one condition does Paul say will be needed to reap a harvest (Gal. 6:9)?
choice: If we do not give up
If we walk in the Spirit

question: To whom does Paul say they should especially do good (Gal. 6:10)?
choice: To those who have shared the gospel with them
To those who are in need
To those who belong to the family of believers

question: How did Paul write (Gal. 6:11)?
What are those who are trying to impress you in the flesh trying to do (Gal. 6:12)?
choice: Entice you to works and away from grace
Put you into bondage of the law
Draw you away from the grace of our Lord

question: Why are those trying to impress you in the flesh compelling you to be circumcised (Gal. 6:12)?
choice: To avoid being persecuted for the cross of Christ
To enslave you in the ways of the world
To lead you away from the grace of our Lord

question: Who does Paul say do not keep the law (Gal. 6:13)?
choice: Those who are in the flesh

question: In what do those who are circumcised boast (Gal. 6:13)?
In what does Paul boast (Gal. 6:14)?
What has been crucified to Paul (Gal. 6:14)?
Paul says circumcision and uncircumcision don’t mean anything but what does count (Gal. 6:15)?
How does Paul in the end address the Galatians (Gal. 6:16)?
choice: As the body of the Spirit

question: What does Paul bear on his body (Gal. 6:17)?
choice: The scars of persecution for Christ

question: What does Paul hope will be with their spirit (Gal. 6:18)?
choice: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
